State space model

ssm_lm.Rd

Computes state space model with one equation. Starting with a simple lm model, build the all state space model and run it.

Use rjd3sts packages.

Usage

ssm_lm(
  x,
  trend = FALSE,
  var_intercept = 0,
  var_trend = 0,
  var_slope = 0,
  var_variables = 0,
  fixed_intercept = TRUE,
  fixed_trend = TRUE,
  fixed_variables = TRUE,
  ...,
  remove_last_dummies = FALSE
)

Arguments

trend

trend

var_intercept, var_slope

variance of the intercept and the slope (used if trend = TRUE).

var_variables

??

fixed_intercept

??

fixed_variables

??.

model

a lm or dynlm model

Value

Returns a list containig :

smoothed_states

\(E[a_t|y_0,\dots,y_n]\)

smoothed_var

\(V[a_t|y_0,\dots,y_n]\)

filtered_states

\(E[a_t|y_0,\dots,y_t]\)

filtered_var

\(E[a_t|y_0,\dots,y_t]\)

filtering_states

\(E[a_t|y_0,\dots,y_{t-1}]\)

filtering_var

\(V[a_t|y_0,\dots,y_{t-1}]\)

data

data used in the original model
